This is a variation of the [[Shadow Imitation Technique]], designed for offensive purposes.<ref name="d2"/> The user extends their shadow along a target's body, which, because the shadow has physical properties, the target can feel.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 208, page 13</ref> There, the shadow can be used for restraint, replacing or adding to the binding of the Shadow Imitation;<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 324, pages 11-13</ref> the closer the user is to their target, the stronger this binding becomes.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 208, page 19</ref> Like the Shadow Imitation, the Shadow–Neck Binding requires a great deal of [[chakra]] to maintain, making it weaker over extended periods of time.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 212, page 7</ref> For this reason, it is most effective when immediately used to strangle a target, hence the name.<ref name="d2"/>

The Shadow–Neck Binding's ability to apply pressure to a body gives the user some additional options. If the user falls victim to a [[genjutsu]], they can use their shadow to break their own finger, freeing themselves from the genjutsu's influence.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 208, page 18</ref> In ''[[The Last: Naruto the Movie]]'', [[Shikamaru Nara]] uses the Shadow–Neck Binding to control the [[Ōtsutsuki clan]]'s [[puppet]], forcing them to fight among themselves.<ref>''[[The Last: Naruto the Movie]]'' novelisation</ref>

== Trivia ==
* Its full name is {{translation|"Leaf Secret: Shadow–Neck Binding Technique"|木ノ葉秘伝・影首縛りの術|Konoha Hiden: Kage–Kubishibari no Jutsu|lit meaning=Tree Leaf Secret: Shadow–Neck Binding Technique}}.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 137, page 10</ref>
* In the anime, it was shown that this technique can be manipulated in a similar manner to the [[Shadow Sewing Technique]].<!-- vague --><ref>''Naruto: Shippūden'' episode 234</ref>
* The technique appears in ''[[Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm]]'' as Shikamaru's ultimate technique. However, rather than strangling the opponent, it binds them to a nearby rock and then tightly squeezes them, destroying the rock and crushing the opponent.
* In ''[[Naruto: Path of the Ninja 2]]'', using this technique on multiple opponents at once gives it the name "Shadow Sinking Technique".
